g.text: Note that band-shifting and bias correction (described in the next section) are applied to normalised
remote-sensing reﬂectance, representative of nadir-viewing conditions.
The bio-optical algorithm QAA performs the inversion of the
optical properties (IOPs) at 443 nm, yielding the coefﬁcients of backscattering by particles
and by coloured detrital matter (including coloured dissolved organic
matter or gelbstoff and particulate detrital matter)
. To perform the band shifting from an input
, the IOPs are calculated at these two wavelengths using
the spectral shape assumed in the QAA for
, and that given by Bricaud et al. [
(since the QAA does not make assumptions on the spectral shape of
at two wavelengths in the blue). Then,
values are estimated with the QAA run in forward
normalisation is necessary to ensure that the estimated
is not a QAA output at that wavelength).
at 510 nm for MODIS-Aqua, band shifting is operated twice from 488 to 510 nm,
and from531 to 510 nm. Then, the ﬁnal estimated value at 510 nmis the weighted average of the two
resultant values. The performance of the QAAappears degraded for long wavelengths, particularly for
in the red, whereas it appears reliable at 443 nm[
], supporting the choice of that wavelength
as a reference. In general, the selection of the QAA for operating the band shifting has the merit
of being consistent with the bio-optical algorithm selected here for generating IOPs from satellite
] see Section 4.3). This band-shifting scheme is also used with speciﬁc adaptations in the
The performance of the band-shifting scheme has been assessed using hyper-spectral data from
radiative transfer simulations and ﬁeld observations [
within a few percent, usually well below 5%. Another assessment has been performed with satellite
]. From global products on a one-twelfth-degree resolution grid, all coincident SeaWiFS
values were accumulated for the year 2003 and compared (approximately
50 million spectra). After band shifting, the median ratio
is closer to 1 in all cases. Thus,
1.030 versus 1.007 after band shifting, i.e., when MODIS-Aqua
1.108 for comparisons between MODIS-Aqua data at 547 nmand SeaWiFS
0.978 after band shifting. At 510 nm, the median ratio is also close to 1 (
distance between 510 nmand the original MODIS-Aqua bands (approximately 20 nm). On the other
hand, improvements are fairly limited in the red domain (
interval are often very low, and relative uncertainties are likely to be high. The results obtained with
satellite data appear satisfactory, taking into account that the errors associated with the band-shifting
scheme cannot be separated fromactual differences between sensor-speciﬁc products.
The strategy adopted in OC-CCI involves the production of a merged data set of
main ocean-colour data streams, currently SeaWiFS, MERIS MODIS-Aqua, and VIIRS, though initial
versions did not include VIIRS (see Table
). Besides the creation of a uniﬁed series of this ECV, it
potentially removes the need for product-speciﬁc merging procedures applied to each derived product
data records have already been used as inputs to merging
] or even produced as merged products [
research. Therefore, with respect to other activities dedicated to producing merged ocean-colour data,
it should fulﬁl the additional requirement that the merging process should not introduce or should
at least minimise spurious temporal artefacts resulting from inter-mission differences. These have
been shown to vary signiﬁcantly with time (mainly seasonally), space, and wavelength [
In the operational context discussed here, a simple and robust strategy has been adopted to address
